Submodules¶

qmt.materials module¶

class qmt.materials.Material(name, properties, eunit=None)[source]¶

Bases: _abcoll.Mapping

Wrapper for an entry in the materials database.

Allows for the retrieval of a material’s properties. Adds units awareness on top of a plain dict containing the properties.

name: str
Material name.
properties: dict
Collection of material properties.
eunit: str, default None
Unit of energy. If specified, all queries for band parameters that have the dimension of an energy return floats with respect to this energy unit. With the default (None), such queries return sympy quantities that have the dimension of an energy.
hole_mass(band, direction)[source]¶

Determine effective mass for a valence band.

Parameters:
  • band (str) – Which valence band: ‘heavy’ or ‘light’ for a specific band. Also ‘dos’ for a density-of-states mass corresponding to both bands.
  • direction (str) – Momentum direction: One of ‘001’, ‘110’, or ‘111’. ‘z’ is equivalent to ‘001’. Can also be ‘dos’ for the scalar density-of-states mass of a corresponding isotropic band dispersion.
serialize_dict()[source]¶

Return a dict with the material properties that can be dumped to json.

class qmt.materials.Materials(matPath=None, matDict=None)[source]¶

Bases: _abcoll.Mapping

Class for creating, loading, and manipulating a json file that contains information about materials.

The default constructor (matPath=None, matDict=None) sets matPath to the module’s materials.json and loads it. If both matPath and matDict are specified, the Materials database is initialized from the given path and then updated with the supplied dict.

matPath : str, default None
Path to the mat json file. If initialized with None, should be set manually before loading/saving.
matDict : dict, default None
Dictionary of materials to fill the database.
add_material(name, mat_type, **kwargs)[source]¶

Generate a material and add it to the matDict.

conduction_band_minimum(mat)[source]¶

Calculate the energy of the conduction band minimum $E_c$ of a semiconductor material.

The reference energy E=0 is fixed to the vacuum level, as defined by the electron affinity of InSb. If Anderson’s rule were exact, this method would return the (negative) electron affinity of mat. Since Anderson’s rule ignores interface effects, it is preferable to use empirically determined band offsets for the alignment of bands in heterostructures rather than electron affinities (c.f. Vurgaftman et al. (2001)). Therefore, we use the electron affinity of a single material as reference point and try to align all other materials according to the respective band offsets. If the material’s valenceBandOffset is not known, we return -mat[electronAffinity], effectively falling back on Anderson’s rule.

mat: Material
Material whose conduction band position is to be determined.
  • valence_band_maximum(mat) is equivalent to self.conduction_band_minimum(mat) - mat[‘directBandGap’]
  • conduction_band_offset(mat1, mat2) is equivalent to self.conduction_band_minimum(mat1) - self.conduction_band_minimum(mat2)
deserialize_dict(db)[source]¶
find(name, eunit=None)[source]¶

Retrieve a named material from the database.

If the material is not found directly, an attempt is made to construct it by mixing two known materials. If that also fails, a KeyError is raised.

name: str
Name of the desired material.
eunit: str
Unit of energy. This is passed on to the Material constructor.
load()[source]¶

Load the materials database from disk.

save()[source]¶

Save the current materials database to disk.

serialize_dict()[source]¶
set_bowing_parameters(name_a, name_b, mat_type, **kwargs)[source]¶

Generate a bowing parameter set and add it to the bowingParameters dict.

valence_band_maximum(mat)[source]¶

Calculate the energy of the valence band maximum $E_v$ of a semiconductor material.

The reference energy E=0 is fixed to the vacuum level, as defined by the electron affinity of InSb. See conduction_band_minimum for additional details.

mat: Material
Material whose valence band position is to be determined.
  • conduction_band_minimum(mat) is equivalent to self.valence_band_maximum(mat) + mat[‘directBandGap’]
  • valence_band_offset(mat1, mat2) is equivalent to self.valence_band_maximum(mat1) - self.valence_band_maximum(mat2)
qmt.materials.conduction_band_offset(mat, ref_mat)[source]¶

Calculate the conduction band offset $E_c - E_{c,ref}$ between two semiconductor materials.

mat: Material
Material whose conduction band position is to be determined.
ref_mat: Material
Material whose conduction band minimum is used as reference energy.
qmt.materials.valence_band_offset(mat, ref_mat)[source]¶

Calculate the valence band offset $E_v - E_{v,ref}$ between two semiconductor materials.

mat: Material
Material whose valence band position is to be determined.
ref_mat: Material
Material whose valence band maximum is used as reference energy

qmt.physics_constants module¶

qmt.physics_constants.parse_unit(s)[source]¶

convert name of a unit into the corresponding sympy value

qmt.physics_constants.to_float(expr)[source]¶

Convert sympy expression involving units to a float. Fails if expr is not dimensionless.
